Posts.Content: Hi everyone! I was diagnosed end March....have had neo adjuvant chemo  Fec-T  6 rounds and am awaiting lumpectomy on the 2nd September .....the oncologist is really happy as the lump which was 2.2cm is not palpable anymore.... me I spend my time worrying because it was really close to the chest wall, so I imagine it spreading, and because my veins now have phlebitis so there won't be a vein for the operation.....but mostly because I read such negative stuff about Tnbc.....can anyone have some patience and give me some positiveity! Much love to all !    Jackie
Posts.Title: Any Triple Negative survivors willing to calm me down!!??

Posts.Content: Thank you ladies!!! It's just so encouraging to hear from ladies who have been through it....you're words are uplifting....very very much so!!!  Crystaljuju are you Jackie too....I took your advice and went for a drive today and did some veggie shopping.....it helps to get out!!! You serious about the 100 percent ...who knows what stage...that's after op right?? Jj sailor....you will be fine through chemo! Just make sure you have time to rest rest rest....and eat super nutrient dense foods...as well as the odd crumpet....the only thing that tastes delicious in my opinion!! Monika thank you! It feels nice having someone say well done for finishing get, I must say I was lucky and didn't get some of the side effects I read about! I am in that online group....sometimes I find it uplifting....other times so sad when I read about recurrence and losing someone, esp when they're really young with babies....omg it sends me into a big big black hole ......thank you so much please keep in touch with me ! Xxxxxx Hug
Posts.Title: Any Triple Negative survivors willing to calm me down!!??

Posts.Content: Ps PCRPCR......WAY TO GO!! omg I WISHHHHHHHHHHHHHH. XXXXXXXX
Posts.Title: Any Triple Negative survivors willing to calm me down!!??

Posts.Content: I plan to have mx if braca tests positive.  I'll hooefully be negative but if not I'll go in strong not post chemo with low bloods etc !
Posts.Title: Any Triple Negative survivors willing to calm me down!!??

Posts.Content: Thanks butterfly for the encouragement xxxxxx
Posts.Title: Any Triple Negative survivors willing to calm me down!!??

Posts.Content: Hi Mags22 of course you can add me as friend..although I didn't know you could do that .....that would be great...takes me ages to find the thread again so am sure there's an easier way!  My we are really similar! I am having a a lumpectomy as my oncologist and surgeon both insist it's enough, and I have to do radiation.  I asked specifically whether a mx gives me a better chance and they both said no!  It's all so confusing and horrible. I decided to go with what they are advising, although if they don't get clear margins then they will have to go back in. I pray to God they won't have to that!  I also want to get tested for braca.....my goodness I have to go on some waiting list and it can take up to 2 years, so am going to have to pay for it myself, and it not cheap, I'd so much rather go on a cruise!!!!  So is mum doing a double mx? I felt awful going through chemo, but 2 weeks out and I feel tired but ok, what about mum? How old is she? I'm 51.   This has hit me like badly, came out of nowhere and reading about tnbc is so depressing. I try not to but inevitably I do ........
Posts.Title: Any Triple Negative survivors willing to calm me down!!??

Posts.Content: Hello!   hahaha didn't even notice I was a penguin thank you! Hooe you have a lovely Sunday ....much love x   Am being very dim but I can find the add to favorites waaaaaaaa
Posts.Title: Any Triple Negative survivors willing to calm me down!!??

Posts.Content: Hello everyone! i am new here and was diagnosed with triple negative 3rd April undergoing Fec T, followed by lumpectomy, followed by rads...hopefully.  Managed Fec quite ok considering but this first T floored me with neutropenia and temperature....low grade but worrying nonetheless.  Spent 3 days on iiv antibiotics in hospital, sent home yesterday with oral antibiotics for a week and anti fungal pills ?! I wonder if it's going to be like this for the 2 remaining rounds? ! Also my urgh can't say the word (tumor) is close to the chest wall.......soooo I was wondering if there are any survivors with similar experiences who feel like giving me a ray of hope ......unless someone been through it it's hard to hear frieds telling you ooohhhh you're going to be fine whilst they're on thier way out to dinner of the gym........thanks and lots of love
Posts.Title: Triple negative survivors , taxotere survivors shout out

Posts.Content: How right you are!! Thanks for replying!! When I was admitted my mouth was white!!!!!! I also like your sunshine rain....but at the moment I feel like a sinking ship, although there's good positive news that this thing is shrinking.....I cannot believe how for granted I used to take everything. I know it's accumalitive but up till now the temperature seems to be the worst se......where can I ask about vitamins and stuff whilst on chemo on this site? Thanks dream thief x
Posts.Title: Triple negative survivors , taxotere survivors shout out

Posts.Content: Thanks Tracy for the words of encouragement!! I have quite a hard time keeping positive! I want things to go as plainly as possible and the se to be 'normal' lol...no hospitals, phlebitis , etc! Just to add to the mix yesterday I tried to stretch my fec d up vein and blew it again so today have to ice it and hold it above my head as there's this hard lump half way up where I felt the fec do something funny to my vein......oh well lovely Sunday to us all on this roller coaster journe
Posts.Title: Triple negative survivors , taxotere survivors shout out

Posts.Content: Hi Ali owl.....thanks for replying!! What a nightmare and worry... It's one thing after he other!! Massaging and stuff is for nothing aye??
Posts.Title: Sore veins post chemo

Posts.Content: Hi ! Is anyone still here ?! I need to ask someone who's been through it...I also had something funny happen to my vein on the second FEC....I sort of felt it go funny running up my vein and now have a hard lump and can't stretch my arm at all! Again this is my good arm which and im scared that when I go in for my operation it's going to be a big trauma! Also this is now about 7 weeks! The initial pain is gone but there's no way I can straighten it and this lump....omg.....onc said plembitiis, nurse said no coz there's no redness at all......
Posts.Title: Sore veins post chemo

Posts.Content: My goodness mine is worse today...maybe because I tried to stretch it a little yesterday and massaged it, also maybe because I am very low on white blood cells!! I mostly worry for my operation...as this is supposed to be my good side and God knows what they're going to need to stick in this already compromised arm.....all I do these days is worry worry worry and I wish I could have a day off!!!
Posts.Title: Sore veins post chemo

Posts.Content: Hiiiiiii so happy for your mum !!!! Yeah!!!! guess what ....even me even me ......onc sent me a text he was so excited......NOTHING TO SEE UNDER THE MICROSCOPE!!!!  Havent been called in for rads yet.  Wonder how long they leave between WLE and rads!  Ps Crystaljuju thank you for your constant support xxxxxxxx hopefully we can just help women through and be done with this shit for now....oooops sorry I started swearing these days lol love to you all jackie ps where's the needy club can't believe I am getting there xxxxxxx
Posts.Title: Good news! Mum got the all clear after surgery!

Posts.Content: Mags22 is mum doing rads? She's tn too right? Xxxxx enjoy carnival dears xxx
Posts.Title: Good news! Mum got the all clear after surgery!

Posts.Content: Haha Crystaljuju glad I made you laugh...thought of you when I got the result! Oh dear I wrote needy club... I am quite needy!!!
Posts.Title: Good news! Mum got the all clear after surgery!

Posts.Content: Hi everyone!!! So glad everyone sounds better! I've done my last T let Thursday!!! I've been flat on the bed but feeling better now.  I always get 99.2.. 99.5... As a matter of fact I have a thermometer in my mouth pretty permanantly these days! OMG Skye is so cute! I just want to hug him! Had appointment with surgeon, surgery is on the 2 nd of September and I'm so anxious although it's a lumpectomy.....followed by radiation.......I pray for all of us! I pray we won't ever have to go through chemo again!  I am sure I will feel very alone after radiation as I am triple negative so there's not targeted treatment for us .  Wonder if there's any other 'club' I can join for support!!?? Big hugs to all! We made it this far! Woohoo
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Yes good luck to everyone! Its hard to believe when you're first starting out but it does pass by quite quickly......I can't believe its over! Xxx
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Pat...friends say surgery is easy compared to chemo....so great your done with that !
Posts.Title: On the last leg of this horrid journey

Posts.Content: Fantastic! Have 2 chemo to go! 14 rads will pass quickly! Congrats! Did,you have lumpectomy or mx
Posts.Title: On the last leg of this horrid journey
